intro: Scuticaria dodgsonii, commonly known as the Dodgson's scuticaria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, daisy-like flowers that typically bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant produces yellow-orange disc flowers surrounded by white to pale yellow ray florets. Native to the southeastern United States, it thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Scuticaria dodgsonii is a perennial herb that plays a role in supporting local pollinator populations.
